text:
if `processingType` is the new name for the old `listType` key, why do the values not match?
You can see in the screenshot that the legacy API shows `listType` as `"STATIC"`, whereas v3 API shows `processingType` as `"MANUAL"`?
Yeah, lots of stuff got shuffled around

STATIC -> SNAPSHOT (if there are filters)
STATIC -> MANUAL (if there are no filters)
DYNAMIC -> DYNAMIC

Hi justin, yes I am working withe endava redesign, we are using react and creating several modules, when I use the default site search, the parameters works fine, except for the porperty field, that is not working

Could you link me to any relevant documentation for site-search? I am still not certain I understand the question.

The `crm/v3/lists` API offers a `/search` endpoint; however, it does not have a property parameter.

sure

<https://www.endava.com/_hcms/v3/site-search/search?portalId=25897843&type=BLOG_POST&offset=7&limit=1&property=title&property=description&analytics=true&q=blog|https://www.endava.com/_hcms/v3/site-search/search?portalId=25897843&type=BLOG_POST&[â€¦]t=1&property=title&property=description&analytics=true&q=blog>

there you can see the search result, I am using property=description&property=title for searching with the q=blog, the result is not using those porperties to filter, the rest of the parameters work porperly
I will give a deep check just in case to what you sent me, let you know if I found anything, thanks
